text: The influence of the Waystones affects the power of commandments issued across Albion and the neighbouring lands. The Waystones have little influence on faraway lands though.\\n\\nA settlement must be linked to another of equal or higher strength if it is to operate at its maximum potential power.\\n\\nThe colour of the rings around settlements indicate the current power of the Waystones there. A pulsing ring indicates that a settlement is not operating at its maximum potential power - upgrade the power of the Waystones in Albions neighbouring settlements in this case.

The influence of the Waystones affects the power of commandments issued across Albion and the neighbouring lands. The Waystones have little influence on faraway lands though.\\n\\nA settlement must be linked to another of equal or higher strength if it is to operate at its maximum potential power.\\n\\nThe colour of the rings around settlements indicate the current power of the Waystones there. A pulsing ring indicates that a settlement is not operating at its maximum potential power - upgrade the power of the Waystones in Albions neighbouring settlements in this case.
Geomantic Web||View the state of the geomantic web - links between province capitals that provide provinces with powerful commandments.
Strength 3 - Building: Geomantic Pylon and allied settlements
Waystone Network||View the influence of the Waystones - links between Albion and her neighbouring lands that provide those provinces with powerful commandments.
Surging Power  - Restore Waystones and construct Waystone Markers
Pulsating Power - Repair Waystones and construct Waystone Beacons
Humming Power - Uncover Waystones and via allied settlements
Flickering Power - Owned and neutral settlements
Extinguished Power - Ruins and enemy settlements
We have attained complete control of this [[url:script_link_campaign_provinces]][[tooltip:{{tt:tooltip_campaign_provinces}}]]province[[/tooltip]][[/url]].

The more warbands you field, the harder it becomes to maintain them all. As supply lines become more complex, gold and supplies will ‘go missing’ -  the chieftains having little idea where they may have gone...

WHAT AND WHERE DIS. The men and monsters of the north have long sought to overthrow the civilisations of the south, but have always been thrown back to their frozen wastelands. But no more! Now, under your control, the Norscan hordes have been unleashed upon the Old World. The Chaos Gods gaze admiringly falls upon the leader of this cataclysmic event: you!
[[col:red]]The settlement chain in this region cannot be built to a high enough tier to construct this building.[[/col]]
In order to research this technology, this settlement must be captured and held for a turn.
[[col:red]]Your race cannot occupy settlements of this type.\\n\\nYou can only occupy settlements in Norsca and coastal settlements.[[/col]]
[[col:red]]Your race cannot colonise ruins of this type.\\n\\nYou can only colonise ruins in Norsca and coastal settlements.[[/col]]
